New Records: Budu Zivzivadze scored a brace to seal Georgia's place in the Euro 2024 playoff finals
Key Match Events: Zivzivadze's goal was initially disallowed but later counted after a VAR review
Maxime Chanot saw a straight red card after reacting angrily to a decision
Zivzivadze doubled Georgia's lead with a simple tap-in
Post-Match Reflections: Luc Holtz's men eventually succumbed to the pressure from Georgia
Luxembourg bowed out with their heads held high despite Chanot's actions
Georgia will march on to face either Greece or Kazakhstan early next week for a place in Germany
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia exerted their influence from the outset and came close to drawing first blood twice midway through the half
Luxembourg crashed out of contention to qualify for their first-ever major tournament
The Euro 2024 qualifying campaign represents a minor success in itself for a nation once seen as mere cannon fodder
Others: The match stats are available on Flashscore
Budu Zivzivadze was awarded the Flashscore Man of the Match
